Students in BU hazing case appear in Brighton court

Seven BU students are accused in an incident in which students were allegedly bound, beaten, and covered with honey and other condiments. (Globe , 12:48 p.m.)

Danvers fire chief arrested on domestic violence, witness intimidation charges

Chief Kevin Farrell was arrested at his Groveland home today following a physical confrontation in the home of his estranged wife, officials said. (Globe, 11:12 a.m.)

Cheaper gas is a
tricky political calculus

Gas prices have fallen 50 cents since mid-April and could hit $3 a gallon by the end of the summer, but politicians are remaining silent on the issue.
Opinion | Scot Lehigh

Where are Mitt Romney’s details?

The Republican candidate takes regular refuge in vague answers and foggy formulations.

Culture part of job at this restaurant

Training for employees of Eastern Standard includes a unique repertoire that seeks to make employees fully versed in the culture and politics of our times.
Opinion | Brian McGrory

Tough landing for roaming bear

What exactly will our environmental officials do for an encore after shooting a black bear 50 feet out of a tree because he had the audacity to visit Chestnut Hill?

High-tech helping farmers markets

With new smartphone apps and other technology, farmers markets are shifting from a cash-only business, and drawing more customers.

Harvard in fight over racist images

Humiliating images of slaves and Brazilian natives, which were commissioned by 19th-century naturalist Louis Agassiz, have caused a dispute between Harvard and the organizer of an exhibit on Agassiz.

Decades of dining in Harvard Square

The eclectic clientele and the zany decor have kept UpStairs on the Square a go-to restaurant.
